intro: Hippobroma, commonly known as the golden cup plant, is a herbaceous perennial native to North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and smartweed. The plant features upright, branched stems and produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are oval-shaped with a distinctive wavy margin and a slightly hairy surface. Hippobroma is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
